Major_Arcs.title: Circus Chaos
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the events within the circus, starting with Paul Bunyan's performance, shifting to public reactions, and escalating into sabotage and conflict involving multiple characters.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Arrival and Initial Excitement
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the circus setting, Paul Bunyan as a performer, and the general public's initial wonder and excitement upon arriving at the circus.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at the Circus and the Giraffe

sub_scenes.title: Intervention and Ambush
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Paul Bunyan's intervention in a threatening situation, his confrontation with Billings, and the subsequent ambush he faces, escalating the conflict beyond simple performance.

narrative_arcs.title: Investigating the Cry for Help and Confronting Billings

sub_scenes.title: Strongman Proposition and Matto Grasso's Envy
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the circus owner and his conflict with Matto Grasso, leading to a job proposition for Paul Bunyan and setting up Matto Grasso's envy and revenge plot.

narrative_arcs.title: The Proposition: Becoming the New Strong Man
Paul Bunyan's Acclaim and Matto Grasso's Envy

sub_scenes.title: Matto Grasso's Sabotage Attempts
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Matto Grasso's escalating attempts to sabotage Paul Bunyan and the circus, from arson to releasing a dangerous ape, and Paul Bunyan's efforts to control the chaos.

narrative_arcs.title: Matto's Renewed Sabotage: The Ape Release
Discovery of the Loose Ape and Paul's Intervention
Arena Observation and Intention to Intervene

sub_scenes.title: Resolution of Circus Conflict and Paul Bunyan's Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the circus chaos with the confrontation between Matto Grasso and Sonny, Paul Bunyan's unintentional rescue, and his subsequent decision to leave the circus despite being offered the strongman position.

narrative_arcs.title: Rejection of Strongman Offer and Departure

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo's Eastern Adventures
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Marco Polo's fantastical adventures in the East, encompassing encounters with mythical creatures, supernatural elements, and quests for rescue and resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Encounters in Tibet and the Forest
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Marco Polo in a dangerous situation in Tibet and then shifts to a mysterious encounter in a forest with a severed talking head, setting a tone of the bizarre and supernatural.

narrative_arcs.title: Marco Polo and the Awful Ogress of Tibet
Discovery of the Severed Talking Head
The Severed Head's Plea for Help

sub_scenes.title: Rescue, Gift, and Journey to Hi-Toun
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Marco Polo's rescue of a man, the gift of a magical dagger, his journey to Hi-Toun, and his arrival in a town observing mourning which is misinterpreted as celebration.

sub_scenes.title: Quest for Princess Lotus and Encounter with the Ogress
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene involves Marco Polo's arrival at Hi-Toun, his meeting with the grieving King, his offer to help find Princess Lotus, and his encounter with the Ogress in disguise leading to a dangerous castle.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Hi-Toun and King's Welcome
The King's Grief and the Missing Princess Lotus
Encounter with a Starving Mother and the Witch's Castle
Entering the Mysterious Castle and Meeting the 'Children'
Confrontation with the Mice and Sword Defense

sub_scenes.title: Ogress's Defeat and Rescue of Princess Lotus
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers the imprisonment by the Ogress, the revelation of Princess Lotus's identity, the use of the magic knife, the escape from the dungeon, and their arrival at the palace.

narrative_arcs.title: Dungeon Escape and Journey to Father
Palace Arrival, Mourning Confusion, and Marriage Reward

Major_Arcs.title: The Treasure of Agra and Revenge
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a tale of treasure, betrayal, and revenge set in a British penal colony and England, culminating in a violent confrontation and a moral conclusion.

sub_scenes.title: Treasure Tale and Penal Colony Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a treasure tale narrated by a treasure keeper and then shifts to a British penal colony, setting the stage for a story of confinement and intrigue.

narrative_arcs.title: Prison Colony Labor and Guard Check
Request to Speak with Captain Brooking

sub_scenes.title: Betrayal and Vow of Revenge
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Captain Brooking's betrayal, Jordan's realization and denial, his vow of revenge, and his eventual release from prison, setting up his quest for vengeance.

narrative_arcs.title: Discovery of Betrayal and Captain's Escape
Release from Servitude and Fare to England
Arrival in England and Renewed Vengeance

sub_scenes.title: Violent Climax and Moral Conclusion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the violent confrontation in the attic to claim the treasure, the intervention of the police, the escape attempt, and concludes with the storyteller's moral lesson about the evils of money.

narrative_arcs.title: Ascent to the Attic and Discovery of Treasure
Responding to Gunshot and Finding the Body
Aftermath and Calling the Homicide Squad
Moral of the Story: Money is Evil

Major_Arcs.title: Dr. Styx and the Haunted Matthews Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers around Dr. Styx's investigation into the supernatural disturbances at the Matthews Estate, haunted by the ghost of Vincent Matthews and the need for forgiveness to resolve the haunting.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Dr. Styx and the Haunted Estate
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Dr. Styx in a dramatic scene, presents the courtroom sentencing of Vincent Matthews, and then shifts to Henry Northrup arriving at the Matthews Estate to seek Dr. Styx's help with supernatural problems.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Warning at Matthews Place

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Vincent Matthews' Ghost
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the warnings against entering the haunted house, Henry's defiant entry, and his confrontation with the spectral form of Vincent Matthews, leading to a philosophical and physical struggle.

narrative_arcs.title: Warning Before Entering the Haunted House
Unexpected Strength and Shift in Power
The Horrifying Revelation of Rosalind's Murder and Forgiveness

sub_scenes.title: Summoning Rosalind and Resolution of the Haunting
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene involves the summoning of Rosalind Matthews' ghost, her confrontation with Vincent, the act of forgiveness, and the resolution of the haunting, concluding with Dr. Styx and Henry leaving the estate.

narrative_arcs.title: Plea for Rest and Conditional Forgiveness
The Test of Brotherly Love and Rejection

Major_Arcs.title: Henry Hudson's Arctic Voyages and Mutiny
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc chronicles Henry Hudson's relentless quest for the Northwest Passage, detailing his voyages, crew discontent, and the tragic mutiny that marked his end.

sub_scenes.title: Hudson's Mission and Initial Voyage
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Henry Hudson and his historical context, his commission by the Dutch East India Company to find the Northwest Passage, and the start of his voyage on the Half Moon.

narrative_arcs.title: The Dutch East India Company's Request
Threat of Mutiny and Change of Course
Entering the Hudson River with Hope
Hudson's Resolve and Return to Holland
New Company and Continued Search for Passage

sub_scenes.title: Arctic Voyage, Mutiny, and Hudson's Fate
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers Hudson's second voyage, the ship becoming icebound, the crew's discontent escalating into mutiny, Hudson being set adrift, and the mutineers facing justice upon their return.

narrative_arcs.title: Extreme Northerly Route and Icebound Ship
Winter Quarters and Waiting for Spring Thaw
The Ice Melts and Voyage Resumes
Crew's Refusal and Demand to Return Home
Mutineers Return Home and Face Justice

Major_Arcs.title: Hassan the Arabian Knight and the Rescue Mission
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Hassan the Arabian Knight on a dangerous mission to rescue the kidnapped daughter of Ali-Ben-Ali from the Dread Tartars, highlighting his bravery, combat skills, and eventual romantic outcome.

sub_scenes.title: Mission Briefing and Journey to the Oasis
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Hassan being summoned by the Caliph, receiving the dangerous mission to rescue the kidnapped daughter, and beginning his perilous journey towards the Tartar territory.

narrative_arcs.title: The Summons and the Dangerous Mission
The Rescue Mission: Daughter of Ali-Ben-Ali
Signs of the Enemy at the Oasis

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration and Combat in the Tartar Camp
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Hassan's approach to the Tartar camp, his infiltration using disguise, his gathering of information, his contact with the kidnapped daughter, and his subsequent capture after being discovered by guards.

narrative_arcs.title: Approaching the Tartar Camp Under Nightfall
Cloak as a Disguise and Infiltration Plan
Reaching the Prisoner's Tent and Contact
Discovery and Confrontation by Tartar Guards
Capture and Recognition as an Outsider

sub_scenes.title: Trial by Combat and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers Hassan's interrogation by Kurgan, the challenge by combat, Hassan's preparation and strategy, the duel itself, his victory, and the romantic resolution with the Caliph's daughter.

narrative_arcs.title: Terms of Combat and Kurgan's Doubt
Victory Shout and Defiant Last Words
Impending Departure and a Necessary Kiss
